text:
Earlier @jerrybuttimer and @AlanFarrell said I was wrong to report Fine Gael delegates had clapped when the DUP's Jeffrey Donaldson called for Ireland to rejoin the Commonwealth

Well here's the video from @aoifegracemoore of @PA that proves otherwise
author: oconnellhugh

text:
The Taoiseach also referred to there being "some good people" in Fianna Fáil in his speech tonight.

That line was not in this earlier version sent to journalists:
author: oconnellhugh

text:
Interesting: A copy of Taoiseach's speech sent to journalists earlier said there would be an election "at some point between now and the summer of next year" 

Tonight, he said there would be an election at "some point between now and 2021"
author: oconnellhugh

text:
Remember Enda Kenny and Fine Gael's Five Point Plan in the 2011 general election campaign? 

Leo Varadkar appears to have resurrected it tonight at the Fine Gael conference with "five steps to build a better future”. 

#FGNC19
author: oconnellhugh

text:
In tomorrow’s Sunday Business Post: 

Backbench unrest in Fine Gael over “aloof” cabinet ministers 

The curious departure of its political director 

The election candidate who has gone down "like a lead balloon” 

#FGNC19

Taoiseach on Conor McGregor: 

"Obviously he has had some trouble with the law in recent months and I wouldn't condone or like to be associaed with the kind of actions he’s been involved in which include prosecution in New York and a potential prosecution in Miami."

text:
Murphy was asked whether it was ever possible to eradicate homelessness. 

After a long answer, he said: "There will always be people who will not be able to find shelter on a given night… 

"… That’s why we as a government will always have those supports in place.”
author: oconnellhugh

text: Housing Minister Eoghan Murphy says it was "irresponsible" of Labour to pledge to end homelessness after the death of Jonathan Corrie in December 2014 #FGNC19

text:
On foot of this Tánaiste Simon Coveney says this evening he hopes to get some "quiet time" with DUP's Jeffrey Donaldson tomorrow at the Fine Gael conference to talk about supporting the withdrawal deal.

Good luck with that.

text:
Definitely the last throw of the dice from May there:

1. No long delay
2. No second referendum
3. It’s all MPs’ fault
4. It’s this deal or no deal
5. Back me or I’m off

text:
Taoiseach confirms first elections for directly elected mayor will take place in 2021 (if voters in Cork, Limerick and Waterford vote to have one) and they will earn the salary of a junior minister.

Mayors will be given wide-ranging powers but council's will still have CEOs.
